intro: Chamaefilix trichomanes-dentata, commonly known as the toothed rock-rose, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its basal rosette of fleshy, lobed leaves. The plant produces small, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
